citations.narrative:
Within a sheltered enclosure there were 2 adult French Bulldogs with a water bowl that was empty and dry. The bowl was
refilled and both dogs immediately began to drink vigorously. One dog took a break at 1 minute but the larger dog
continued drinking vigorously for approximately 40 seconds more (1.5 minutes total). Then the dog that took a break
came back and drank for another 30 seconds. The owner stated that the dogs had been given water earlier that morning
(approximately 5 hours ago). The owner also stated that the dogs always turn their bowl over but has not worked on a
plan to prevent this from occurring. Failure to provide continual access to water can result in discomfort and serious
dehydration. The facility must ensure that potable water is made continuously available to all dogs.
This was corrected at the time of inspection and must continue from this day forward (6 December 2024).
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative at the facility and followed up with a phone
call to discuss the category of a direct nci. The facility representative acknowledged this. A plan was made to deliver the
report to the facility representative on the morning of 9 December 2024.
